ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 1-2 hours
2h
1.5 hours
Less than 1 hr most weeks. On weeks with midterm/final, ~8 hrs. On weeks where paper assignments were due, ~8 hrs.
2 hours/week
5hrs

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Having a speaker about each cancer is a very important strength of the course. I think having the PSA and HPV discussions were not really helpful. It would have been beneficial to just discuss the science behind PSA and HPV.
Good course covering lots of different cancers, and associated research
Interesting course, touch upon a lot of cancer types. Good interactive. Not too much workload.
Great guest lecturers. Professor's lectures were a bit bland. Could have been much more exciting class given the interesting topic but it was a bit boring.
It was a great course! I enjoyed the breadth of the class in learning about all of the different cancers.
Dr. Cartmel was awesome. There were a lot of guest lectures, which I don't love, just because everyone has a different teaching style. Overall it was a really great course though.
Great topics coverage in cancer epidemiology.
Broad overview of all cancers and great visiting speakers.

Strength: Provides a variety of information on general trends in cancer epidemiology as well as specific information on various cancers. Weaknesses: Very much a survey course, no particular topic discussed in great depth.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Brenda Cartmel  Brenda is fantastic. She is sweet, knowledgeable, helpful, and available for questions.
Instructor: Brenda Cartmel  excellent teacher, kind lady
Instructor: Brenda Cartmel  Lovely instructor who brings home-made strawberry chocolate on Valentine's Day.
Instructor: Brenda Cartmel  Very kind, knowledgeable, approachable professor! Could have more structured lectures where the topics and lessons are more clear
Instructor: Brenda Cartmel  She was very passionate about the topic and receptive to student feedback! One of my favorite professors at Yale (:
Instructor: Brenda Cartmel  Awesome! So nice and helpful
Instructor: Brenda Cartmel  Brenda is very helpful and informative.
Instructor: Brenda Cartmel  Very down to earth and always available to help and speak with students.
Instructor: Brenda Cartmel  Informative and accommodating.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Great class for learning about cancers and building a base for advanced cancer epi courses.
If the syllabus was not changed during the term will be better
Good, recommended.
I would recommend parts of the course...it was a lot of scattered information
A broad overview of the epidemiology and etiology of the various cancers.
an good overview of cancer stats and topics of interest
Great introduction and overview of cancer epidemiology. Will recommend it to fellow students.
Yes!
Survey course on a variety of general trends in cancer epidemiology, with some cancers slightly more focused on.
